title: Leaf | Definition, Parts, & Function | Britannica
body: Learn about the definition, parts, and types of leaves, the green outgrowths from the stem of vascular plants that produce food by photosynthesis. Explore the diversity and adaptations of leaves in different plants, from simple to complex, and their roles in ecology and evolution.

title: Leaf - Wikipedia
body: A leaf (pl.: leaves) is a principal appendage of the stem of a vascular plant, usually borne laterally aboveground and specialized for photosynthesis.Leaves are collectively called foliage, as in "autumn foliage", while the leaves, stem, flower, and fruit collectively form the shoot system. In most leaves, the primary photosynthetic tissue is the palisade mesophyll and is located on the upper ...

title: 3.1: Leaves - Biology LibreTexts
body: Leaves are shoot structures that attach to stems and branches at nodes. Leaves are made up of cells that usually contain a high concentration of chloroplasts (cell organelles unique to plants) and are specialized sites for photosynthesis. We will explore photosynthesis in greater detail later; for now, remember that photosynthesis is the ...

title: 30.10: Leaves - Leaf Structure, Function, and Adaptation
body: Figure 30.10.1 30.10. 1: Trichomes: Trichomes give leaves a fuzzy appearance as in this (a) sundew (Drosera sp .). Leaf trichomes include (b) branched trichomes on the leaf of Arabidopsis lyrata and (c) multibranched trichomes on a mature Quercus marilandica leaf. title: Plant Leaves and Leaf Anatomy - ThoughtCo
body: Learn about the basic features, functions, and types of leaves in plants. Find out how leaves are composed of different tissues, such as epidermis, mesophyll, and vascular tissue, and how they perform photosynthesis and other specialized functions. Discover some examples of leaves that are adapted to different habitats and conditions, such as carnivorous plants, insect-eating animals, and camouflage mimics.
